attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I understand that some people are less academic than others but surely those people should not be limited to a grade C because of it. It\'s not up to the system to catagorise (tell me if i didn\'t spell that right) young people in this way. It is up to the system to try and push forward those who are less academic and not pull them back.
I myself was told that i would not get a C in maths or science at GCSE on the higher paper and even though i knew this wasn\'t true, my family knew it and my friends knew it i still had to tell my science teacher to "shove his foundation paper where the sun doesn't shine" to get my voice heard. I\'m glad i did, because even though i didn\'t get above a C in either subject i still felt like my hard work had paid off in the end. Also a group of my friends and people who i didn\'t really know found the courage to fight for themselves as well and i know for a fact that at least three of them, whose target grades where C\'s and D\'s, got A\'s and A*\'s.
For some people. being put on the foundation paper is like being told without a doubt that you\'re stupid. My story and that of my friends just goes to show that with a little push in the right direction target grades mean nothing.
